thread_summary: The Scout Paradox - How One Character Breaks Every Narration Rule (And Why It Works)

social.content: TKAM's 'soft, drowsy imagery of afternoon naps' isn't atmosphere—it's a trap. Harper Lee creates 'deceptively peaceful veneer' to make moral violence hit harder. Adult-Scout knows what's coming. Child-Scout (and first-time readers) don't.
